root: ^The air in the almost-magical forest library is filled with the sweet scent of blooming flowers. Large wooden bookshelves tower overhead, their shelves adorned with ancient tomes and delicate scrolls.
^Amidst the enchanting ambiance, you notice a quiet, almost inaudible flower person carefully browsing through a large hardcover book.
^“Hi there, I’m in need of some directions. Would you happen to know how I can get to the ocean?”
^The flowerkin, almost shocked with your approach, shuts the book with a loud slam, startling themselves in the process.
^"T-This is a library! Keep it down a bit...”
^They seem embarrassed by their own conduct rather than genuinely disapproving of yours.
^A faint blush grows on their face after they finally turn to face you, locking eyes.

s: ^“I’m sorry, I didn’t mean to startle you. What are you reading?”
^“There is no one else here anyways... You’re the only one here reading a book.”

g-0: ^The pale green colored bookworm visibly defuses from the sudden shock of company. They adjust the narrow, large-rimmed glasses framing their delicate yet sculpted face. A shy, soft pout adorns their otherwise stern appearance.
^“I suppose that is understandable. P-Pardon my reaction. Y-You just... nevermind. I was too into this book of floral communication. I-It is rather interesting.”
^“No worries. What is your name, by the way? That book looks interesting.”
^_“I have no idea what that means. But I’m interested in who you are?”

c-3: ^“I have no idea what that means. But I’m interested in who you are?”
^<i>You are about to enter a mini-game. If you do well, you can score some extra points with this character! Control your bee with WASD.

g-1: ^You reach out to shake the hand of the mysteriously fidgety flowerkin, but they subtly react by inching backwards.
^Fey crosses their arms straddling the large book to their chest. They subtly look down on the book but play it off quickly.
^“It’s whatever, this is just something I grabbed just now.”
^“I’d love to get to know you and the stuff you’re interested in. But I need to be home before sunset and I’m quite lost.”
^“I need to get home as soon as possible, could you point me in the right direction?”
g-2: ^Fey almost seems disappointed in your sudden change of subject, but doesn’t let it affect their demeanor.
^“You’re supposed to take the road just down here. There’s supposed to be a sign that lets you know where you’re going.”
^Fey adjusts the books on the nearest bookshelf and puts the large book back where it belonged.
^Kindly thank Fey and let them know you’ll visit again.
^Wave them goodbye and quickly jog down the road they pointed towards.
